website_summaries.verdict: The Brother ImageCenter ADS-1500W lets you scan directly to an assortment of cloud services, but only over a Wi-Fi connection to a network.
pros: Can scan directly to USB memory key and an assortment of cloud services, as well as to a PC
cons: Some minor oversights, including failing to install software that the installation program says it will install

customer_reviews.title: Not only will it work poorly, it will enrage you the entire time.
customer_reviews.text: This is among the worst products I have ever purchased. The hardware is fine, it's the software that renders it unusable. The majority of the settings just don't get applied, and when they do they aren't stored so you'll have to navigate the worst user interface since 1997 if you want to set it all again. All of the online help is geared for people who are initiating scans from their machine with a connected USB, which I have to assume is approximately zero people. I recently dusted it off again in the hope that new firmware might fix the pile of broken things, but nothing seems to have changed.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Multipage Issue
customer_reviews.text: Received my new ADS1500W in February 2017. A friend whose identical model has performed well recommended it. Mine does everything well except feed multipage docs one page at a time. Always feeds at least two or more pages together. I scan so infrequently, I didn't discover this for several months. Because of my lack of need for multipage scanning (very rare), have decided to live with it (hand feed it) at this late date rather than deal with the hassle of returning. Buyers beware. Read the reviews. I'm not the only buyer to experience this problem.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Has a large delay when using USB
customer_reviews.text: I use this to scan to a USB, and it has a delay of almost 1 minute with each scan, sometimes it times out and cancels the scan. The scan quality is good when it works, but it takes so long that I wish I had bought another product. I have tried contacting user support. They responded relatively quickly initially, but when I responded, they did not respond. Never found a solution to my problem.
customer_reviews.author: David Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Problem child needs spoon feeding.
customer_reviews.text: It has two half-inch paper guides at the mouth of the scanner slot and none at the top. So the rollers grab paper with the finesse of a lawn mower, the top of the paper gets thrown to the side, it keeps feeding the now-skewed paper till it crumples and tears one edge of it, and then it says, "Ahem, you're using paper that's too long [?]" It needs guides all along both paper edges, and improvised, clipped-on guides work only if you're very, very careful--and lucky.
customer_reviews.author: John Prosise

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: First, don't believe that you'll be able to download better software from Brother. I hit an obvious system error (theirs) multiple times on multiple days. Three emails to them and no responses. The clock keeps resetting itself to some old date and time. The device does do a good job of scanning papers, which is, after all, its real purpose. The card scanner chops the card's image, which is probably OK for just keeping information but not acceptable for further use (e.g., a newsletter ad). The small size of the unit is a real plus for saving desk space and moving around.
customer_reviews.author: David M. Williams

customer_reviews.title: It was hard to setup.... wireless difficult to get working.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why this thing was so hard to get working. It does work, eventually.... Wireless is really slow and unreliable, so I don't think that feature is very useful. If you are thinking of sharing this device...well good luck with that. Build quality is quite nice. However, the setup is just very counter-intuitive and confusing. The ID scanner is good; however, it doesn't crop the ID scan, so your ID scan has mostly white spaces in it. If I had to do it again... I'd probably go with a Fujitsu.
customer_reviews.author: E Kim

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS
customer_reviews.text: If you're an organizational nerd like me, you'll LOVE this. I did a lot of research on scanners before settling with the Brother ADS1500W and I'm glad I did! It combines multi-page documents into PDFs right out the box which is exactly what I wanted. It's fast. It's compact, which is great for the minimalist aesthetic I have going on my desk. The one problem I have, however, is that the wireless setup is really difficult on my MAC computer. I still haven't quite figured it out.. if anybody has pointers, I'd be happy to take them. Otherwise-GREAT SCANNER.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie

customer_reviews.title: A great scanner for at home work
customer_reviews.text: This scanner is great for at-home desktop use. I use it to scan documents for work into my mac and it works great. My only complaint is that you can only feed a few papers at a time, so it makes scanning large documents a little difficult. Also, the program that you have to use to scan things on your computer takes a little getting used to - you cant just press a button and go. BUT it works great for scanning cards, pictures, and other small objects. I would recommend it as long as you don't need to be able large documents fast.
customer_reviews.author: Krista Huber

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic scanner
customer_reviews.text: The initial setup was slow going but once that was out of the way, this scanner is amazing. Scans a two-sided document in just a few seconds. Very good quality scans. I have it set up to email the scan. Has address book where you can add email addresses so you can select 1 address to send it to, or send the one scan to multiple email addresses. I'm very impressed with this scanner. Much better than those large scanners. Affordable wireless, color, double sided scan, small desktop footprint.
customer_reviews.author: Cisop Sixpence

customer_reviews.title: Just What I Needed!
customer_reviews.text: Love it so far. Bought it for scanning colored artwork. Haven't had any problems and easy to use once you know how to. I took a star off because there are no directions. They give you directions for install but no manual. I had to google search for the manual. I haven't had any jams. Also, it comes in white not black as picture. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Beth WilsonTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: It was OK, now it doesn't work at all.
customer_reviews.text: It started out pretty good. Kind of expensive for the scan quality, but it's pretty portable for a scanner. When scanning multiple pages, I end up having to hold them in place and also place the scanner against a taller object so that the pages drop in more naturally. Otherwise, pages are misaligned and end up jamming. I never do more than 10pp at a time, but somehow it always ends up jamming, unless I do the aforementioned. I purchased in June 2014. It stopped working entirely about 2 weeks ago. So, 18 months of average scans that I had to carefully feed in like a bird feeding its babies? Not sure it was wroth it.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: does not connect to dropbox
customer_reviews.text: I have bought 2 of these units. the attractive description is that they can scan without being hooked up to computer directly to dropbox this worked relatively well (some problems with feeder, but for 1-3 page documents, even two sided, it worked well) for about six months. about one month ago (may 2016) , they stopped connecting to dropbox. We called, apparently this is a brother-dropbox problem that they have been promising to fix for about a month, but still haven't as of writing this review. Maybe a few negative reviews will jot things along.
customer_reviews.author: M.R.K.

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars! I love it!
customer_reviews.text: 5 stars! I love it! This is a great scanner. I found it easy to set up and use. I use it every day to scan my receipts into Quicken. The pages feed quickly. I have yet to figure out how to capture scanned credit cards, but that was just an extra feature. I bought it more for receipts.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Buckeyne

customer_reviews.title: Brother ADS1500W compact color scanner
customer_reviews.text: Good price and works very well. I particularly like the unit because of its small footprint. One feature that pleasantly surprised me is its ability to scan both sides of the paper at the same time. And it's fast. The only negative is that I would like a better system to support the documents in the inbox (while feeding), and also some mechanism to catch the pages as they exit the scanner. I wouldn't think it would be that difficult to create.
customer_reviews.author: AndyT

customer_reviews.title: Works great and is fast.
customer_reviews.text: Just got this hooked up today and I can say the install was super easy. I have it plugged into my computer in our office and also configured for wi-fi for the other staff to use. I have it working with our practice management software to scan documents into files as needed. Works great. It's fast, simple, has good image quality, and has a small footprint. I'm running this on a HP all in one PC that has Windows 10 64bit.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Swankhouse

customer_reviews.title: Buy something else
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine at first (setup was a bit of a pain) but one month later and one week later the scanner is crumpling paper and now the remote connection is failing. It's been over a month so Amazon is declining to allow a return. Buy the Fujitsu ScanSnap instead (had one at the office and it worked great for years.)
customer_reviews.author: ColoCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Desktop Scanner. Quick and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this scanner for a month now and am really starting to get some good use of out it. Pros: Compact and folds up. Great Software (for Mac). Easy to use. Great clear scans. Multi sheet works very well. Touch screen is responsive and effective. Very quick clear scanning. Very easy to use. Cons: Does not come with Evernote Software for Scanning (not sure if you can get it separately) but it is SIGNIFICANTLY cheaper than the Evernote Scanner. Bottom Line: Just a great piece of equipment. I highly recommend it. I have no regrets and for the price it is a bargain.
customer_reviews.author: Y. Kingsley

customer_reviews.title: NOT WORTH IT AT ALL!
customer_reviews.text: Since my first posting I have had it destroy 2 more docs and repeatedly attempted to scan an executed contract only to have it misfeed and destroy the signature page. Lousy document feed scanner for 1-sided or 2-sided scanning of documents. Problem with feed guides that do not keep document aligned resulting in document slippage and bad copies. Have ruined some docs because of this. You need to set on high scan resolution (e.g. 600) and slightly hold doc as it scans which is a disadvantage for wireless scanning. Also had issues with wireless scanning. Only real benefit is is size and ability to do 2-sided scanning.
customer_reviews.author: jimbo57

customer_reviews.title: Missing Parts
customer_reviews.text: I own and like the scanner and bought one for my mother as a gift. The box did not contain the user guides or the software CD, and the scanner was missing the page separator. The box didn't look like it was opened though. I didn't want to ask her to return it, so I bought a page separator for $10. (The OEM one costs $30!). This scanner has been a PITA. Edit 7/2018. Scanner has been working great ever since.
customer_reviews.author: Compos Mentis

customer_reviews.title: wonder box
customer_reviews.text: What an awesome scanner. I bought this for my office. I have many documents I need to scan. Before I used Xerox multi-function printer to scan. It scans well but it took some time to scan many pages. This unit scans really fast and doesn't take much space at all. When folded it takes as much space as a cracker case. It connects to the computer easily and you can choose file type to save. It's so easy to scan now that I scan almost everything!
customer_reviews.author: Mlord

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend this scanner.
customer_reviews.text: I really love this product. it does everything i hoped it would. I had done a lot of research on different scanners and it was a toss up between this one and the Fuji scanner. Im glad i picked this one. It is fast and does a great job. Many options on scanning with the software. I like the fact that it does double sided scanning. I would highly recommend this product for home or small business scanning.
customer_reviews.author: Schindler Snacks

customer_reviews.title: Great desktop scanner
customer_reviews.text: This scanner replaced my Neat scanner. I wish it died sooner, because this Brother desktop scanner is much faster and easier to use and it takes up less real estate on my desk. I love that I can scan direct to my pc from the scanner with just a couple of touches to the screen. Reduced by one star because the shortcut feature isn't really a shortcut - you have to touch the screen just as many times to use the shortcut as without it.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Nunez

customer_reviews.title: Paper misalignment is a big issue.
customer_reviews.text: The driver disk provided with the product is not good for Mac with recent update. I had to download the driver from Brother, but it was not updated for a good run at Mac. The worst issue is that the pages are often mislaligning and I have to help aligning by hand. Brother should be more aware of these issues.
customer_reviews.author: JGGJ

customer_reviews.title: Amazing.
customer_reviews.text: This? It's the best thing since sliced bread. I have no idea how I lived without one. I have a ton of paper being a teacher and the software alone makes this worth it. So a lot of old graduate school notes that I don't need often? Scanned and now my bookshelves have free space! If you have wrinkled paper, or your tore out a staple? Be careful as that might jam it. Once you jam the machine, the software will stop but that's ok, you can just "stack" them together and it will make one .pdf file out of it. Overall, I'm incredibly impressed with the speed and accuracy of how it feeds.
customer_reviews.author: KathyDTop Contributor: Knitting

customer_reviews.title: Just some thoughts!
customer_reviews.text: A good scanner but the 20 sheet feed would be better if it were more robust, but prep stacking the pile for scanning is not that much of a bother. The cover lid is in need of paper guide to keep the paper from drawing to one side as the rollers pull the bottom sheet out. However the cost would go up with more bells. All in all great for occasional scanning.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good scanner...once you figure out the setup!
customer_reviews.text: The scanner itself is good quality, scans quickly and has a variety of places you can scan to automatically. The only issue I had was with the setup. The Quick Setup Manual is written poorly and is also difficult to read (fuzzy, no quality print and pics in black and white). If you use Windows 10, the CD doesn't work. They don't tell you anywhere in the enclosed documents that you need to go to the Brother website and download the drivers and software. Once you get all of that done, however, the scanner is pretty nice.
customer_reviews.author: Pete & Jo

customer_reviews.title: Great For Electronic Filing
customer_reviews.text: Love the wireless capability. I had no problem setting up the FTP function to send documents to my NAS. However, I was not able to get the network function to work so I could scan documents to my PC, and gave up since the FTP was all I really needed. Also, another big improvement would be to put all scanning options directly on scanner. I do not wish to put any bloated software directly on my computer in order to use advanced scan options. This scanner is great for making electronic copies of bills, tax returns, and anything else you would need a copy of, but don't want to store in a stack of papers in your basement.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Z.

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!!!
customer_reviews.text: Not for use with scanning items like passports or books. Loose pages only and simple ID cards. Fit my application and no issues.
customer_reviews.author: TC

customer_reviews.title: Good scanner but frustrating to use sometimes.
customer_reviews.text: Using this scanner is often frustrating. I had this setup to email me the pdfs, but it often says that it runs out of memory, when scanning a two or three page document. So I have to scan using a usb instead. Not a show stopper but annoying when it has the capability to scan and email. When I used it last I had to factory reset it because it would not scan anything.
customer_reviews.author: Pielord13

customer_reviews.title: Love it for Google Drive!
customer_reviews.text: Scanned all of our photos from the film days really easily. The software is a bit temperamental but the hardware is great. Daily I use the scan to Google Drive option from the touch screen on it and it transmits the scans over WiFi to my Google Drive instantly.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Wi

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cross-platform scanner, works best with a NAS
customer_reviews.text: I have had several dual-sided ADF scanners (ScanSnaps mostly) and they always were a pain with my use of Linux and MacOS and so on. They also cost up to 10x as much as this scanner. This scanner is awesome because it's small, cheap (comparatively), and I can scan right to my NAS for use on any operating system, including a chromebook.
customer_reviews.author: Brock Tice

customer_reviews.title: Compact and Super Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: We have had this scanner for a while now and it's awesome! Hooked up to wireless easily, scans easily to multiple pc's with an easy to use interface. Highly recommend to a person who doesn't need to scan multiple pages quickly. It stores so compact. The expense receipt envelope (if needed) is super easy to use and works well. Only good/positive things about this scanner.
customer_reviews.author: Snyderstein

customer_reviews.title: Great at first
customer_reviews.text: I was pretty excited about this purchase after first receiving it. We have several other brother devices and all work well. This scanner worked well for the first couple of weeks, now it consistently pulls 2-3 pieces of paper at a time when trying to scan. Unfortunately I went to go return the product and am 1 day out from being able to return it. I guess I will have to deal with Brother on the warranty side......
customer_reviews.author: Jordan G.

customer_reviews.title: Failed to deliver on key features
customer_reviews.text: This printer did not do everything it was advertised as being capable of. 1. Scan to FTP did not work. 2. Scan to CIFS share worked for some shares, but not others 3. Linux drivers did not work for headless server Setup was extremely complicated and very frustrating. Software was very slow and frequently unclear.
customer_reviews.author: cypher

customer_reviews.title: Scans those unusually long documents!
customer_reviews.text: Ever wanted to scan those long long documents like a vehicle purchase type document? Well this is it. You have to look up how to setup it up, but I have document nearly 3ft long, and it scanned it! The bonus part, regular docs can be scanned front and back in one pass. This is compact, WiFi connection and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: CazuaL6

customer_reviews.title: This Brother scanner is excellent for the money
customer_reviews.text: With everything transmitted electronically these days my fax machine is becoming obsolete, and I can't get by anymore in the office without a scanner! This Brother scanner is excellent for the money. Although I consider myself a fairly advanced PC user, the average end user will find wireless setup easy enough to walk through. The user-friendly ControlCenter quickly scans documents to an editable PDF format.
customer_reviews.author: HitesMites

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner
customer_reviews.text: For a small foot print scanner, this thing does a great job. I use it to scan all our invoices and the PDF file makes them even look better and easier to read. You can set up a simple button to drop the file in your drop box and you don't need to be connected to your PC to get it there, just have an internet connection. Got one for work, now I want one for home too. Scan pictures and the color look excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Allan M

customer_reviews.title: I upgraded to the Fujitsu Scansnap and the performance is much better. If you have to choose between the two ...
customer_reviews.text: The scanner jams frequently and does not connect to wifi reliably. That being said, it still gets the job done for a small amount of scanning. I upgraded to the Fujitsu Scansnap and the performance is much better. If you have to choose between the two scanners, go with the Fujitsu.
customer_reviews.author: Nolan P. Lim

customer_reviews.title: It easy to use and serves all my scanner needs perfectly
customer_reviews.text: took a couple of days working with Brother assistants to get it to work on my new mac, but it was worth the effort. It easy to use and serves all my scanner needs perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: William J Remmel

customer_reviews.title: I love this scanner
customer_reviews.text: I love this scanner! It scans faster than my large printer/scanner/fax that I have at home. It scans both sides at once and leaves out the blank pages. I would definitely buy this again. The only thing that I didn't like was that it came with a CD installation disc and my laptop doesn't have a CD drive. My husband had to go online and find the online installation driver ... which he did - but I wish that would have been included. I have used this multiple times and have not had any problems.
customer_reviews.author: Kym

customer_reviews.title: The 1500 is a bottom of the line scanner.
customer_reviews.text: It has limited features and capabilities but at least the features it has work. The 2700 I purchased was an absolute disaster. If you want to waste time and money purchase the 2700. If you want helpful tech support find a different company. If you have any issues just save yourself time and frustration eat the loss and throw the unit away.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Lubcke

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for decluttering
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for decluttering, but the pages get pulled in on an angle and scanned in crooked. The software is supposed to correct for it, and it does, but not always.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Great! Works on OSX 10.10.1 MBP Retina.
customer_reviews.text: High praise for ease of use: usb or flash drive. Loaded on OSX 10.10.1 and works great on MBP Retina. Very fast and reliable, very few paper jambs (only if loading more that 15+ sheets). Using the double sided scan alot more than I imagined with tax time coming. Small enough to tuck away on a shelf when not in use. I didn't feel secure with their cloud service (requires an upload to the Brother cloud just to tunnel to dropbox or google drive).
customer_reviews.author: StudioWalker

customer_reviews.title: Good, reliable scanning
customer_reviews.text: I gave up a large desktop scanner with a document feeder for this Brother scanner. It is faster, has good resolution, and the document feeder is (overall) reliable. It does struggle occasionally with flimsy or wrinkled originals, but generally performs better than my older HP scanner. I do miss the flatbed option occasionally... but not often.
customer_reviews.author: CoRo

customer_reviews.title: Unstable
customer_reviews.text: Seemed good, and I purchased 2 units. I am not using both because of unstable connection, difficult to use, frequent jamming. One unit is completely out of order. This is another disappointing experience from brother products.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Chang Kim

customer_reviews.title: Love the compactness
customer_reviews.text: Love the compactness. Bought for desktop use and needed to do double sided scanning. Came with receipt/check sleeve for easier scanning. My only qualm is that it didn't always scan straight, it would veer to the side for crooked scans. The receipt sleeve has an arrow and directions on it that come through the scan, so I always had to crop the scan every time. Without those 2 things I would have given it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: HypnotiqRose

customer_reviews.title: Brother ADS1500W Compact Color Desktop Scanner.
customer_reviews.text: .Brother ADS1500W Compact Color Desktop Scanner. It's great, just what I need.. I am making a family tree and I need a nice scanner to scan my pictures and documents, it perfect. It take up small amount of space on my desk.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: but not as straight forward as I would have liked. I recall having to make user account instead ...
customer_reviews.text: It jams more than I would expect for a scanner of this price point. If there are folds in the paper (as mail often has) it will grab multiple pages at once and either jam or skip pages. Scanning to a samba share on my NAS was doable, but not as straight forward as I would have liked. I recall having to make user account instead of mounting the share as an anonymous user. Very mediocre for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Great Scanner
customer_reviews.text: Great scanner, it has excited all my expectations. I would not think twice to recommend to someone else. I have learned that some items do scan better on a flat bed but I have an old brother MFC that does that. 98% of what I scan is a document of some kind and this scanner is prefect.
customer_reviews.author: Randy G.

customer_reviews.title: Best document scanner for Chromebook owners
customer_reviews.text: This document scanner is excellent. My setup is connected via wireless and I use the email feature to send PDF scans to myself, also set it up to fo FTP as well to a local server. It's been 100% reliable and very easy to use. Once set up it is as simple as place a stack of papers in the scanner and pressing the shortcut button to scan to email. This device is perfect for Chromebook users as you don't need to plug it into a computer to use it
customer_reviews.author: Kernow Media

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I wished it had an Ethernet net port. Works with Ubuntu and Debian Linux.
customer_reviews.author: Chad E. Chenault

customer_reviews.title: So far this is a good scanner. Wireless works great other than double sided ...
customer_reviews.text: So far this is a good scanner. Wireless works great other than double sided is not available when the deivce is added through Printers and faxes. Have to load the SW package to get that. Speedy little thing, scans fast and is good quality scan. needs a receiving tray to make it much better. Love the portability of this unit!
customer_reviews.author: Hoopah

customer_reviews.title: Setup is bad. Works great afterwards.
customer_reviews.text: Once you fight your way through the setup - which is especially bad for a no-Java allowed household and poorly documented - it works great. Use the web interface to setup emails and shortcuts. Do not bother with scanning jobs going through their servers. Bad idea from privacy perspective and unnecessary complication with little benefit. Once email is set up (Gmail in our case), it is great and we never needed anything else.
customer_reviews.author: DIDENKO

customer_reviews.title: That was over a year ago and it continues to do a great job.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to start the process of scanning all receipts and go paperless. That was over a year ago and it continues to do a great job.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: like the compact size
customer_reviews.text: good value for what it is - but sometimes i have to access the printer from my desktop to scan instead of just pressing scan on the machine.
customer_reviews.author: E. Ingala

customer_reviews.title: Good enough scanning quality
customer_reviews.text: The web interface is clunky (like all Brother products) and some of the limitations (i.e. the number of pre-defined network/ftp destinations are limited to 5) are a bit short sighted. Overall quality wireless connection, good scanning quality, and quick scanning makes this a great product overall. I love the on device interface, easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: mesco

customer_reviews.title: Pleased with Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used it much, but it works extremely well. Scans multiple pages fast. I have it set up to scan to a network drive and it works well, although it takes a while (a few seconds) to send to the network.
customer_reviews.author: Miles Eastman

customer_reviews.title: Legal documents are the max.
customer_reviews.text: Overall it works pretty well but it claims to scan documents up to 34" I have never been able to get it to scan our 22.25 inch contract documents. It stops about 18 inches in an complains that it is jammed or paper too long. It is not jammed. So I would say it's great if you only need up to legal size paper.
customer_reviews.author: rough68fish

customer_reviews.title: Just Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: It arrived as described and on time. I have two other scanners which I have not used since I received this one. It is the perfect scanner for those that need to scan legal size, credit cards, receipts quickly!
customer_reviews.author: Illetsac

customer_reviews.title: Great for small desks
customer_reviews.text: Quick delivery ,Works perfectly! No Issues! Great for small desks.
customer_reviews.author: Andre Weatherford

customer_reviews.title: Does as it says
customer_reviews.text: Scans are fast. Pages must be carefully arranged so multiple sheets are not fed in at once. My main use is to upload scans straight to the cloud. I use a chromebook, so I can't install scanning apps and control the scanner from them. (Some scanners might provide a web page. HP multi-function printers generally seem to.) Scanning directly to the cloud is a nice way to do it. Double-sided scanning was a requirement for me. So this device fit all the requirements. So far has worked flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: roger a fleming

customer_reviews.title: Compact color desktop scanner
customer_reviews.text: It's been over a year since I bought this one. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: john hayes

customer_reviews.title: It was a beautiful piece of equipment
customer_reviews.text: It was a beautiful piece of equipment, but it wouldn't work for the purpose that I needed it for (the fault was not with the scanner or Brother, it was with the software manufacturer, NEAT, who had NO CUSTOMER SERVICE).
customer_reviews.author: WILLIAM SCHLOSSENBERG

customer_reviews.title: the BEST
customer_reviews.text: This is the best scanner ever! It is so fast and double sided things don't take any extra time! It is small and takes up very little space on my desk. I had a HUGE pile of documents to scan for work and when I was done I was almost sad that I had nothing left to scan. I would HIGHLY recommend this scanner.
customer_reviews.author: Meredith Shafer

customer_reviews.title: Scans directly to a share folder from the scanner's control panel easily.
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I needed. I wanted a scanner that I could walk up to, put some pages in it and then (by using only the scanner) scan directly to my NAS drive (WD My Cloud). I was able to configure the network location and credentials by using the web interface and then it just worked. Excellent!
customer_reviews.author: Nagratz

customer_reviews.title: Paper jams
customer_reviews.text: This scanner gets a lot of paper jams and even when it doesn't have a paper jam it rips the edges of my papers. It also scans the papers diagonally. The scan to email feature is very convenient but it is very frustrating to constantly have paper jams.
customer_reviews.author: kelly

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: this scanner is great. bought this one for the house after buying one for the office 3 years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick C

customer_reviews.title: Decent scanner.
customer_reviews.text: Decent scanner. Lots of ways to get data out (wifi+email, USB stick, etc.). Small feeding tray. Sometimes jams. I've seen all-in-one printers which do better for less. But they're also bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Nice scanner, right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Nice scanner, right out of the box. It took less than 10 minutes to set up on my wireless network and I was scanning shortly after. It is small but fairly heavy, which I like. Scanning is as fast as I need it to be and the quality is fine. The only reason I didn't give this a five star rating is that I can't seem to figure out how to make the plastic card scan work--I'm sure I'll figure it out but right out of the box it seems to not work.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Okay
customer_reviews.text: Harder to use than described, not very user friendly. Not very good directions. Leaves too much up to you to figure out without documentation.
customer_reviews.author: Paca ranchgirl

customer_reviews.title: Scanning few papers is headache, if one gets stuck ...
customer_reviews.text: Scanning few papers is headache, if one gets stuck cant delete from the ones scanned sucessfully, had to redo from start. You cant preview the scanned pdf untill you save it.
customer_reviews.author: Tejbir S.

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrific little scanner. It's fast, yields great quality scans, and works with most any operating system. I'm currently using it with a Mac OS X laptop, a Linux desktop (Fedora 23), and a Windows 10 laptop. No issues on any platform.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Rankin

customer_reviews.title: User Friendly from Start to Finish
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with ease of set up and the out put is excellent ... the intent of this purchase was to de-paper my life and believe this Brother Compact scanner is going to get me there. Very pleased with quality and ease of use ... scanning my life is going to take a long time, but this Brother scanner is going to make it easy and practically effortless. VERY pleased ... And great price too!!
customer_reviews.author: M5

customer_reviews.title: Good reliable little scanner.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice scanner that will do double sided color and works well with Paperport. It can be finicky feeding some types of paper but I like it much better than my canon all in one. It is fairly small and seems pretty well built. I am using it to get a paperless office.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Henderson

customer_reviews.title: but it isn't super easy to access
customer_reviews.text: This product has ok value. I mostly got it because it included a special receipt feature, but it isn't super easy to access, set up, nor use.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: I love this technology and the scanner.
customer_reviews.text: This save so much time and space. I now can find all my receipts, paper works with orderly fashion in the computer base on year, month etc... and it is fast scan too. I would highly recommend it... will see how durable this model is. Time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: M. Huynh

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner
customer_reviews.text: Love this, got three! One for office, home office, and RV.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

customer_reviews.author: Moose335

customer_reviews.title: Handy!
customer_reviews.text: So far this has been a handy tool for me. It's fast and connects directly to my PC. The one thing the user must be careful of is making sure documents are completely straight in the tray before pressing "Start". If they are crooked at all, your scan won't be nice or it may jam.
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: Windows 10 is a roadblock to this fairly new unit. I would consider alternatives.
customer_reviews.text: It does not work properly with Windows 10. Upon calling there support team I got nothing.. When I called HP the reacted to the problem immediately for the four products that I have of theirs.
customer_reviews.author: Disteagle1

customer_reviews.title: Great little machine
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with thios scanner. It works well as a stand alone device as well as connected to my computer. It is fast and accurate producing crisp and clear documents. Along with the bundled software it is great for organizing all types of paperwork.
customer_reviews.author: Barton Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Really like this scanner!
customer_reviews.text: Scanner works great! Solid build and quality. Output quality is excellent. I especially like that I can email myself a scanned document without having to boot my computer! Scanning speed is plenty fast for what I require (every day home scanning tasks). Zippy quick.
customer_reviews.author: Telemachus

customer_reviews.title: Good wifi scanner
customer_reviews.text: I hooked this up at a business. You can set multiple shortcuts on the touch screen. Those shortcuts can be set for network shares or FTP. Easy to setup and easy to manage.
customer_reviews.author: ITPro

customer_reviews.title: I love the speed of this and the auto setting
customer_reviews.text: I love the speed of this and the auto setting. My main issue comes from the auto feed and the roller set-up for the same. It will feed pages into the scanner crooked and crumple them about 1 out of 5 if the originals paper is not 18lb ' ish. (i.e. Onion skin or old school papers that were done on Mimeo and magazine pages are the ones that tend to give the most problems).
customer_reviews.author: WILLIAM W.

customer_reviews.title: unit is ok. a little expensive for how much ...
customer_reviews.text: unit is ok. a little expensive for how much it gets stuck. does what I need it to do , but every 5 scans it gets stuck.

customer_reviews.title: A neat scanner with feature-packed software
customer_reviews.text: Really like the wireless features, took a bit of time to set up. Extremely fast! But pages need to be loaded carefully or they will jam.

customer_reviews.title: Does what I need.
customer_reviews.text: Does what I need. Use it to scan stuff via email mostly but the local scan feature works also. Set up the SMTP to go out via gmail and set up a bunch of shortcut to scan directly to various email destinations. Lets you dump all that paper.

customer_reviews.text: The scanner constantly pulls multiple sheets of paper through it and quickly jams. Avoid this scanner at all costs.

customer_reviews.title: So far so good

customer_reviews.text: Form factor is good, no driver issues too which is always nice. Would give it 5 stars if I was happy with the software but I am not. Ended up downloading a freeware program that scans docs into pdf much better for me.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent scanner

customer_reviews.title: Scans Directly to Email - No computer required.
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing. Didn't have to have a local computer for any part of the setup. Basic setup was a breeze. Scan to Email directly from the unit was what I was looking for and this device delivered.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Good product for a good price. Scans really quick with good quality. Love that I can scan directly to a USB stick without a computer. Only two disappointments: when it scans both sides at once, the second pages image is upside down and the need to fan out the pages of a large document can be cumbersome.
customer_reviews.author: Edie M

product_meta.title: Brother ADS1500W Compact Color Desktop Scanner with Duplex and Web Connectivity
product_meta.description: Style:ADS1500WBrother ADS-1500W Sheetfed Scanner - 600 dpi Optical
feature_bullets: Scans single and double-sided documents in a single pass, in both color and black/white, at up to 18 ppm
Wireless network connectivity, plus USB interface for local connections. Operating system compatibility : Windows XP, Windows Vista, Windows 7, Windows 8, Mac OS X v10.6.8 - v10.8.x, Linux

Intuitive 2.7" color TouchScreen display with customizable shortcuts for common scanning destinations, including cloud applications such as GOOGLE DRIVE, EVERNOTE, DROPBOX, PICASA WEB ALBUMS, FACEBOOK, FLICKR, BOX, and SkyDrive
Easily scans business and embossed plastic I.D. cards, receipts, photos, and documents up to 34"^ in length through the 20-page auto document feeder
Enhanced "scan-to" destinations, including: PC (file, image, e-mail, and OCR), FTP, Network, E-mail server, USB Flash Drive, cloud applications, plus mobile devices using the free iPrint & Scan app
